2015-09-10.description:
Initial revision. This YANG file augments
the base MANO NSD
2015-09-10.reference: Derived from earlier versions of base YANG files

meta.description: Any meta-data needed by the UI

control-param.description:
List of control parameters to manage and
update the running configuration of the VNF

group-tag.description: A simple tag to group control parameters

url.description: This is the URL where to perform the operation

method.description:
This is the method to be performed at the uri.
POST by default for action

payload.description:
This is the operation payload or payload template as stringified
JSON. This field provides the data  to be sent for this operation
call

action-param.description:
List of action parameters to
control VNF

group-tag.description: A simple tag to group monitoring parameter

url.description: This is the URL where to perform the operation

method.description:
This is the method to be performed at the uri.
POST by default for action

payload.description:
This is the operation payload or payload template to be sent in
the data for this operation call

2014-10-27.description:
Initial revision. This YANG file defines
the Network Service Descriptor (NSD)
2014-10-27.reference: Derived from earlier versions of base YANG files

logo.description:
File path for  the vendor specific logo. For example icons/mylogo.png.
The logo  should be part of the network service

connection-point.description:
List for external connection points.
Each NS has one or more external connection
points. As the name implies that external
connection points are used for connecting
the NS to other NS or to external networks.
Each NS exposes these connection points to
the orchestrator. The orchestrator can
construct network service chains by
connecting the connection points between
different NS.

name.description: Name of the NS connection point.

short-name.description: Short name for VLD for UI

root-bandwidth.description: For ELAN this is the aggregate bandwidth.

leaf-bandwidth.description: For ELAN this is the bandwidth of branches.

vnfd-connection-point-ref.description: A list of references to connection points.

vnfd-id-ref.description:
A reference to a vnfd. This is a
leafref to path:
    ../../../nsd:constituent-vnfd
    + [nsd:id = current()/../nsd:id-ref]
    + /nsd:vnfd-id-ref
NOTE: An issue with confd is preventing the
use of xpath. Seems to be an issue with leafref
to leafref, whose target is in a different module.
Once that is resovled this will switched to use
leafref

vnfd-connection-point-ref.description:
A reference to a connection point name
in a vnfd. This is a leafref to path:
    /vnfd:vnfd-catalog/vnfd:vnfd
    + [vnfd:id = current()/../nsd:vnfd-id-ref]
    + /vnfd:connection-point/vnfd:name
NOTE: An issue with confd is preventing the
use of xpath. Seems to be an issue with leafref
to leafref, whose target is in a different module.
Once that is resovled this will switched to use
leafref

constituent-vnfd.description:
List of VNFDs that are part of this
network service.

member-vnf-index.description:
Identifier/index for the VNFD. This separate id
is required to ensure that multiple VNFs can be
part of single NS

start-by-default.description: VNFD is started as part of the NS instantiation

scaling-group-descriptor.description:
scaling group descriptor within this network service.
The scaling group defines a group of VNFs,
and the ratio of VNFs in the network service
that is used as target for scaling action

min-instance-count.description:
Minimum instances of the scaling group which are allowed.
These instances are created by default when the network service
is instantiated.

max-instance-count.description:
Maximum instances of this scaling group that are allowed
in a single network service. The network service scaling
will fail, when the number of service group instances
exceed the max-instance-count specified.

vnfd-member.description: List of VNFs in this scaling group

member-vnf-index-ref.description: member VNF index of this member VNF

count.description:
count of this member VNF  within this scaling group.
The count allows to define  the number of instances
when a scaling action targets this scaling group

ns-config-primitive-name-ref.description: Reference to the NS config name primitive

placement-groups.description: List of placement groups at NS level

member-vnfd.description: List of VNFDs that are part of this placement group

member-vnf-index-ref.description: member VNF index of this member VNF

vnf-depends-on-ref.description: Reference to VNF that sorce VNF depends.

vnffgd.description: List of VNF Forwarding Graph Descriptors (VNFFGD).

short-name.description: Short name for VNFFGD for UI

vnfd-connection-point-ref.description: A list of references to connection points.

order.description: A number that denotes the order of a VNF in a chain

vnfd-id-ref.description:
A reference to a vnfd. This is a
leafref to path:
    ../../../../nsd:constituent-vnfd
    + [nsd:id = current()/../nsd:id-ref]
    + /nsd:vnfd-id-ref
NOTE: An issue with confd is preventing the
use of xpath. Seems to be an issue with leafref
to leafref, whose target is in a different module.
Once that is resovled this will switched to use
leafref

vnfd-connection-point-ref.description:
A reference to a connection point name
in a vnfd. This is a leafref to path:
    /vnfd:vnfd-catalog/vnfd:vnfd
    + [vnfd:id = current()/../nsd:vnfd-id-ref]
    + /vnfd:connection-point/vnfd:name
NOTE: An issue with confd is preventing the
use of xpath. Seems to be an issue with leafref
to leafref, whose target is in a different module.
Once that is resovled this will switched to use
leafref

vnfd-id-ref.description:
A reference to a vnfd. This is a
   leafref to path:
       ../../../nsd:constituent-vnfd
       + [nsd:id = current()/../nsd:id-ref]
       + /nsd:vnfd-id-ref
   NOTE: An issue with confd is preventing the
   use of xpath. Seems to be an issue with leafref
   to leafref, whose target is in a different module.
   Once that is resovled this will switched to use
   leafref

vnfd-connection-point-ref.description:
A reference to a connection point name
   in a vnfd. This is a leafref to path:
       /vnfd:vnfd-catalog/vnfd:vnfd
       + [vnfd:id = current()/../nsd:vnfd-id-ref]
       + /vnfd:connection-point/vnfd:name
   NOTE: An issue with confd is preventing the
   use of xpath. Seems to be an issue with leafref
   to leafref, whose target is in a different module.
   Once that is resovled this will switched to use
   leafref

id.description: Identifier for the classifier match attribute rule.

parameter-pool.description:
Pool of parameter values which must be
pulled from during configuration

name.description: Name of the configuration value pool

range.description: Create a range of values to populate the pool with

start-value.description: Generated pool values start at this value

end-value.description: Generated pool values stop at this value

2014-03-28.reference:
RIFT yang extensions for converting yang files to Google
Protocol Buffers (protobuf) using rift protoc-c extensions.

2015-09-10.description:
Initial revision. This YANG file defines
the Virtual Link Descriptor (VLD)
2015-09-10.reference: Derived from earlier versions of base YANG files

short-name.description: Short name for VLD for UI

root-bandwidth.description: For ELAN this is the aggregate bandwidth.

leaf-bandwidth.description: For ELAN this is the bandwidth of branches.

vnfd-connection-point-ref.description: A list of references to connection points.

member-vnf-index-ref.description:
A reference to the consituent-vnfd id in nsd.
Should have been a leafref to:
 '/nsd:nsd-catalog:/nsd:nsd/constituent-vnfd/member-vnf-index-ref'.
Instead using direct leaf to avoid circular reference.

vnfd-connection-point-ref.description: A reference to a connection point name in a vnfd

physical-network.description:
Name of the phsyical network on which the provider
network is built.

2015-09-10.description:
Initial revision. This YANG file defines
the Virtual Network Function (VNF)
2015-09-10.reference: Derived from earlier versions of base YANG files

id.description: Identifier for the internal connection points

short-name.description: Short name of the connection point

virtual-interface.description: Container for the virtual interface properties

type.description:
Specifies the type of virtual interface
between VM and host.
VIRTIO          : Use the traditional VIRTIO interface.
PCI-PASSTHROUGH : Use PCI-PASSTHROUGH interface.
SR-IOV          : Use SR-IOV interface.
OM-MGMT         : Used to specify openmano mgmt external-connection type

vpci.description:
Specifies the virtual PCI address. Expressed in
the following format dddd:dd:dd.d. For example
0000:00:12.0. This information can be used to
pass as metadata during the VM creation.

logo.description: Vendor logo for the Virtual Network Function

service-function-chain.description: Type of node in Service Function Chaining Architecture

service-function-type.description:
Type of Service Function.
NOTE: This needs to map with Service Function Type in ODL to
support VNFFG. Service Function Type is manadatory param in ODL
SFC. This is temporarily set to string for ease of use

mgmt-interface.description: Interface over which the VNF is managed.

endpoint-type.description: Indicates the type of management endpoint.

ip.description: Specifies the static IP address for managing the VNF.

vdu-id.description: Use the default management interface on this VDU.

cp.description: Use the ip address associated with this connection point.

path.description: The HTTP path for the dashboard

https.description: Pick HTTPS instead of HTTP , Default is false

port.description: The HTTP port for the dashboard

vnf-configuration.description:
Information regarding the VNF configuration
is captured here.

config-method.description: Defines the configuration method for the VNF.

netconf.description: Use NETCONF for configuring the VNF.

protocol.description: Protocol to use for netconf (e.g. ssh)

rest.description: Use REST for configuring the VNF.

script.description:
Use custom script for configuring the VNF.
This script is executed in the context of
Orchestrator.

script-type.description: Script type - currently supported : bash, expect

charm.description: Juju charm to use with the VNF.

mgmt-ip-address.description:
IP address to be used to configure this VNF,
optional if it is possible to resolve dynamically.

config-attributes.description:
Miscelaneous input parameters to be considered
while processing the NSD to apply configuration

config-priority.description:
Configuration priority - order of confgiration
to be applied to each VNF in this NS,
low number gets precedence over high number

config-delay.description: Wait (seconds) before applying the configuration to VNF

config-primitive.description:
List of configuration primitives supported by the
configuration agent for this VNF.

parameter.description: List of parameters to the configuration primitive.

data-type.description: Data type associated with the name.

default-value.description: The default value for this field

parameter-pool.description: NSD Parameter pool name to use for this paramter

read-only.description:
The value should be greyed out by the UI.
Only applies to parameters with default values.

hidden.description:
The value should be hidden by the UI.
Only applies to parameters with default values.

seq.description: Sequence number for the configuration primitive.

internal-vld.description:
List of Internal Virtual Link Descriptors (VLD).
The internal VLD describes the basic topology of
the connectivity (e.g. E-LAN, E-Line, E-Tree)
between internal VNF components of the system.

short-name.description: Short name of the internal VLD

root-bandwidth.description: For ELAN this is the aggregate bandwidth.

leaf-bandwidth.description: For ELAN this is the bandwidth of branches.

physical-network.description:
Name of the phsyical network on which the provider
network is built.

connection-point.description:
List for external connection points. Each VNF has one
or more external connection points. As the name
implies that external connection points are used for
connecting the VNF to other VNFs or to external networks.
Each VNF exposes these connection points to the
orchestrator. The orchestrator can construct network
services by connecting the connection points between
different VNFs. The NFVO will use VLDs and VNFFGs at
the network service level to construct network services.

id.description: Identifier for the internal connection points

short-name.description: Short name of the connection point

mgmt-vpci.description:
Specifies the virtual PCI address. Expressed in
the following format dddd:dd:dd.d. For example
0000:00:12.0. This information can be used to
pass as metadata during the VM creation.

image.description:
Image name for the software image.
If the image name is found within the VNF packaage it will
be uploaded to all cloud accounts during onboarding process.
Otherwise, the image must be added to the cloud account with
the same name as entered here.

image-checksum.description:
Image md5sum for the software image.
The md5sum, if provided, along with the image name uniquely
identifies an image uploaded to the CAL.

alarm-id.description:
This field is reserved for the identifier assigned by the cloud
provider

name.description: A human readable string to identify the alarm

description.description: A string containing a description of this alarm

vdur-id.description: The identifier of the VDUR that the alarm is associated with

repeat.description:
This flag indicates whether the alarm should be repeatedly emitted
while the associated threshold has been crossed.

enabled.description:
This flag indicates whether the alarm has been enabled or
disabled.

severity.description: A measure of the important or urgency of the alarm

metric.description: The metric to be tracked by this alarm.

statistic.description: The type of metric statistic that is tracked by this alarm

operation.description:
The relational operator that defines whether the alarm should be
triggered when the metric statistic is, say, above or below the
specified threshold value.

value.description:
This value defines the threshold that, if crossed, will trigger
the alarm.

period.description:
The period defines the length of time (seconds) that the metric
data are collected over in oreder to evaluate the chosen
statistic.

evaluations.description:
This is the number of samples of the metric statistic used to
evaluate threshold crossing. Each sample or evaluation is equal to
the metric statistic obtained for a given period. This can be used
to mitigate spikes in the metric that may skew the statistic of
interest.

internal-connection-point.description:
List for internal connection points. Each VNFC
has zero or more internal connection points.
Internal connection points are used for connecting
the VNF components internal to the VNF. If a VNF
has only one VNFC, it may not have any internal
connection points.

id.description: Identifier for the internal connection points

short-name.description: Short name of the connection point

internal-interface.description: List of internal interfaces for the VNF

name.description:
Name of internal interface. Note that this
name has only local significance to the VDU.

virtual-interface.description: Container for the virtual interface properties

type.description:
Specifies the type of virtual interface
between VM and host.
VIRTIO          : Use the traditional VIRTIO interface.
PCI-PASSTHROUGH : Use PCI-PASSTHROUGH interface.
SR-IOV          : Use SR-IOV interface.
OM-MGMT         : Used to specify openmano mgmt external-connection type

vpci.description:
Specifies the virtual PCI address. Expressed in
the following format dddd:dd:dd.d. For example
0000:00:12.0. This information can be used to
pass as metadata during the VM creation.

external-interface.description:
List of external interfaces for the VNF.
The external interfaces enable sending
traffic to and from VNF.

name.description:
Name of the external interface. Note that
this name has only local significance.

vnfd-connection-point-ref.description: Name of the external connection point.

virtual-interface.description: Container for the virtual interface properties

type.description:
Specifies the type of virtual interface
between VM and host.
VIRTIO          : Use the traditional VIRTIO interface.
PCI-PASSTHROUGH : Use PCI-PASSTHROUGH interface.
SR-IOV          : Use SR-IOV interface.
OM-MGMT         : Used to specify openmano mgmt external-connection type

vpci.description:
Specifies the virtual PCI address. Expressed in
the following format dddd:dd:dd.d. For example
0000:00:12.0. This information can be used to
pass as metadata during the VM creation.

vcpu-count.description: Number of vcpus for the VM.

storage-gb.description: Amount of disk space in GB.

trusted-execution.description: This VM should be allocated from trusted pool

mempage-size.description:
Memory page allocation size. If a VM requires
hugepages, it should choose LARGE or SIZE_2MB
or SIZE_1GB. If the VM prefers hugepages it
should chose PREFER_LARGE.
LARGE        : Require hugepages (either 2MB or 1GB)
SMALL        : Doesn't require hugepages
SIZE_2MB     : Requires 2MB hugepages
SIZE_1GB     : Requires 1GB hugepages
PREFER_LARGE : Application perfers hugepages

cpu-pinning-policy.description:
CPU pinning policy describes association
between virtual CPUs in guest and the
physical CPUs in the host.
DEDICATED : Virtual CPUs are pinned to
            physical CPUs
SHARED    : Multiple VMs may share the
            same physical CPUs.
ANY       : Any policy is acceptable for the VM

cpu-thread-pinning-policy.description:
CPU thread pinning policy describes how to
place the guest CPUs when the host supports
hyper threads:
AVOID   : Avoids placing a guest on a host
          with threads.
SEPARATE: Places vCPUs on separate cores,
          and avoids placing two vCPUs on
          two threads of same core.
ISOLATE : Places each vCPU on a different core,
          and places no vCPUs from a different
          guest on the same core.
PREFER  : Attempts to place vCPUs on threads
          of the same core.

count.description: Number of devices to attach to the VM.

numa-node-policy.description:
This policy defines numa topology of the
guest. Specifically identifies if the guest
should be run on a host with one numa
node or multiple numa nodes. As an example
a guest may want 8 vcpus and 4 GB of
memory. But may want the vcpus and memory
distributed across multiple numa nodes.
The NUMA node 1 may run with 6 vcpus and
3GB, and NUMA node 2 may run with 2 vcpus
and 1GB.

node-cnt.description: The number of numa nodes to expose to the VM.

mem-policy.description:
This policy specifies how the memory should
be allocated in a multi-node scenario.
STRICT    : The memory must be allocated
            strictly from the memory attached
            to the NUMA node.
PREFERRED : The memory should be allocated
            perferentially from the memory
            attached to the NUMA node

id.description:
NUMA node identification. Typically
it's 0 or 1

memory-mb.description:
Memory size expressed in MB
for this NUMA node.

vcpu.description:
List of vcpus to allocate on
this numa node.

paired-thread-ids.description: List of thread pairs to use in case of paired-thread numa

ovs-acceleration.description:
Specifies Open vSwitch acceleration mode.
MANDATORY: OVS acceleration is required
PREFERRED: OVS acceleration is preferred

ovs-offload.description:
Specifies Open vSwitch hardware offload mode.
MANDATORY: OVS offload is required
PREFERRED: OVS offload is preferred

type.description:
Specifies the type of hypervisor.
KVM: KVM
XEN: XEN

host-epa.description: Specifies the host level EPA attributes.

cpu-model.description:
Host CPU model. Examples include: SandyBridge,
IvyBridge

cpu-socket-count.description: Number of sockets on the host.

cpu-core-count.description: Number of cores on the host.

cpu-core-thread-count.description: Number of threads per cores on the host.

vdu-depends-on-ref.description:
Reference to the VDU that
source VDU depends.

placement-groups.description: List of placement groups at VNF level

member-vdus.description: List of VDUs that are part of this placement group

name.description:
Place group construct to define the compute resource placement strategy
in cloud environment

requirement.description:
This is free text space used to describe the intent/rationale
behind this placement group. This is for human consumption only

strategy.description:
Strategy associated with this placement group
  Following values are possible
    - COLOCATION: Colocation strategy imply intent to share the physical
                  infrastructure (hypervisor/network) among all members
                  of this group.
    - ISOLATION: Isolation strategy imply intent to not share the physical
                 infrastructure (hypervisor/network) among the members
                 of this group.

http-endpoint.description: List of http endpoints to be used by monitoring params

path.description: The HTTP path on the management server

https.description: Pick HTTPS instead of HTTP , Default is false

port.description: The HTTP port to connect to

polling_interval_secs.description: The HTTP polling interval in seconds

method.description:
This is the method to be performed at the uri.
GET by default for action

headers.description: Custom HTTP headers to put on HTTP request

monitoring-param.description: List of monitoring parameters at the NS level

group-tag.description: A simple tag to group monitoring parameters

value-integer.description: Current value for an integer parameter

value-decimal.description: Current value for a decimal parameter

value-string.description: Current value for a string parameter

json-path.description: The jsonpath to use to extract value from JSON structure

object-path.description: The objectpath to use to extract value from JSON structure

min-length.description: Minimum string length for the parameter

max-length.description: Maximum string length for the parameter

2015-04-23.description:
Initial revision. This YANG file defines
the reusable base types for VNF Management
and Orchestration (MANO).
2015-04-23.reference: Derived from earlier versions of base YANG files

api-type.description: Type of API to fetch monitoring params

json-query-method.description:
The method to extract a value from a JSON response

NAMEKEY - Use the name as the key for a non-nested value.
JSONPATH - Use jsonpath-rw implemenation to extract a value.
OBJECTPATH - Use objectpath implemenation to extract a value.

param-value-type.description: The type of the parameter value

widget-type.description: Type of the widget, typically used by the UI.

cpu-feature-type.description:
Enumeration for CPU features.

AES: CPU supports advanced instruction set for
AES (Advanced Encryption Standard).

CAT: Cache Allocation Technology (CAT) allows
an Operating System, Hypervisor, or similar
system management agent to specify the amount
of L3 cache (currently the last-level cache
in most server and client platforms) space an
application can fill (as a hint to hardware
functionality, certain features such as power
management may override CAT settings).

CMT: Cache Monitoring Technology (CMT) allows
an Operating System, Hypervisor, or similar
system management agent to determine the
usage of cache based on applications running
on the platform. The implementation is
directed at L3 cache monitoring (currently
the last-level cache in most server and
client platforms).

DDIO: Intel Data Direct I/O (DDIO) enables
Ethernet server NICs and controllers talk
directly to the processor cache without a
detour via system memory. This enumeration
specifies if the VM requires a DDIO
capable host.

alarm-severity-type.description: An indication of the importance or ugency of the alarm

alarm-metric-type.description: The type of metrics to register the alarm for

alarm-statistic-type.description:
The type of statistic to used to measure a metric to determine
threshold crossing for an alarm.

alarm-operation-type.description:
The relational operator used to define whether an alarm should be
triggered when, say, the metric statistic goes above or below a
specified value.

data-type.description: Data type associated with the name.

default-value.description: The default value for this field

parameter-pool.description: NSD Parameter pool name to use for this paramter

read-only.description:
The value should be greyed out by the UI.
Only applies to parameters with default values.

hidden.description:
The value should be hidden by the UI.
Only applies to parameters with default values.

vnf-configuration.description:
Information regarding the VNF configuration
is captured here.

config-method.description: Defines the configuration method for the VNF.

netconf.description: Use NETCONF for configuring the VNF.

protocol.description: Protocol to use for netconf (e.g. ssh)

rest.description: Use REST for configuring the VNF.

script.description:
Use custom script for configuring the VNF.
This script is executed in the context of
Orchestrator.

script-type.description: Script type - currently supported : bash, expect

charm.description: Juju charm to use with the VNF.

mgmt-ip-address.description:
IP address to be used to configure this VNF,
optional if it is possible to resolve dynamically.

config-attributes.description:
Miscelaneous input parameters to be considered
while processing the NSD to apply configuration

config-priority.description:
Configuration priority - order of confgiration
to be applied to each VNF in this NS,
low number gets precedence over high number

config-delay.description: Wait (seconds) before applying the configuration to VNF

config-primitive.description:
List of configuration primitives supported by the
configuration agent for this VNF.

parameter.description: List of parameters to the configuration primitive.

data-type.description: Data type associated with the name.

default-value.description: The default value for this field

parameter-pool.description: NSD Parameter pool name to use for this paramter

read-only.description:
The value should be greyed out by the UI.
Only applies to parameters with default values.

hidden.description:
The value should be hidden by the UI.
Only applies to parameters with default values.

seq.description: Sequence number for the configuration primitive.

vcpu-count.description: Number of vcpus for the VM.

storage-gb.description: Amount of disk space in GB.

ovs-acceleration.description:
Specifies Open vSwitch acceleration mode.
MANDATORY: OVS acceleration is required
PREFERRED: OVS acceleration is preferred

ovs-offload.description:
Specifies Open vSwitch hardware offload mode.
MANDATORY: OVS offload is required
PREFERRED: OVS offload is preferred

type.description:
Specifies the type of hypervisor.
KVM: KVM
XEN: XEN

host-epa.description: Specifies the host level EPA attributes.

cpu-model.description:
Host CPU model. Examples include: SandyBridge,
IvyBridge

cpu-socket-count.description: Number of sockets on the host.

cpu-core-count.description: Number of cores on the host.

cpu-core-thread-count.description: Number of threads per cores on the host.

trusted-execution.description: This VM should be allocated from trusted pool

mempage-size.description:
Memory page allocation size. If a VM requires
hugepages, it should choose LARGE or SIZE_2MB
or SIZE_1GB. If the VM prefers hugepages it
should chose PREFER_LARGE.
LARGE        : Require hugepages (either 2MB or 1GB)
SMALL        : Doesn't require hugepages
SIZE_2MB     : Requires 2MB hugepages
SIZE_1GB     : Requires 1GB hugepages
PREFER_LARGE : Application perfers hugepages

cpu-pinning-policy.description:
CPU pinning policy describes association
between virtual CPUs in guest and the
physical CPUs in the host.
DEDICATED : Virtual CPUs are pinned to
            physical CPUs
SHARED    : Multiple VMs may share the
            same physical CPUs.
ANY       : Any policy is acceptable for the VM

cpu-thread-pinning-policy.description:
CPU thread pinning policy describes how to
place the guest CPUs when the host supports
hyper threads:
AVOID   : Avoids placing a guest on a host
          with threads.
SEPARATE: Places vCPUs on separate cores,
          and avoids placing two vCPUs on
          two threads of same core.
ISOLATE : Places each vCPU on a different core,
          and places no vCPUs from a different
          guest on the same core.
PREFER  : Attempts to place vCPUs on threads
          of the same core.

count.description: Number of devices to attach to the VM.

numa-node-policy.description:
This policy defines numa topology of the
guest. Specifically identifies if the guest
should be run on a host with one numa
node or multiple numa nodes. As an example
a guest may want 8 vcpus and 4 GB of
memory. But may want the vcpus and memory
distributed across multiple numa nodes.
The NUMA node 1 may run with 6 vcpus and
3GB, and NUMA node 2 may run with 2 vcpus
and 1GB.

node-cnt.description: The number of numa nodes to expose to the VM.

mem-policy.description:
This policy specifies how the memory should
be allocated in a multi-node scenario.
STRICT    : The memory must be allocated
            strictly from the memory attached
            to the NUMA node.
PREFERRED : The memory should be allocated
            perferentially from the memory
            attached to the NUMA node

id.description:
NUMA node identification. Typically
it's 0 or 1

memory-mb.description:
Memory size expressed in MB
for this NUMA node.

vcpu.description:
List of vcpus to allocate on
this numa node.

paired-thread-ids.description: List of thread pairs to use in case of paired-thread numa

physical-network.description:
Name of the phsyical network on which the provider
network is built.

parameter.description: List of parameters to the configuration primitive.

data-type.description: Data type associated with the name.

default-value.description: The default value for this field

parameter-pool.description: NSD Parameter pool name to use for this paramter

read-only.description:
The value should be greyed out by the UI.
Only applies to parameters with default values.

hidden.description:
The value should be hidden by the UI.
Only applies to parameters with default values.

parameter-group.description: Grouping of parameters which are logically grouped in UI

parameter.description: List of parameters to the configuration primitive.

data-type.description: Data type associated with the name.

default-value.description: The default value for this field

parameter-pool.description: NSD Parameter pool name to use for this paramter

read-only.description:
The value should be greyed out by the UI.
Only applies to parameters with default values.

hidden.description:
The value should be hidden by the UI.
Only applies to parameters with default values.

vnf-primitive-group.description: List of configuration primitives grouped by VNF.

vnfd-id-ref.description:
A reference to a vnfd. This is a
leafref to path:
    ../../../../nsd:constituent-vnfd
    + [nsd:id = current()/../nsd:id-ref]
    + /nsd:vnfd-id-ref
NOTE: An issue with confd is preventing the
use of xpath. Seems to be an issue with leafref
to leafref, whose target is in a different module.
Once that is resovled this will switched to use
leafref

name.description: Name of the primitive in the VNF primitive

http-endpoint.description: List of http endpoints to be used by monitoring params

path.description: The HTTP path on the management server

https.description: Pick HTTPS instead of HTTP , Default is false

port.description: The HTTP port to connect to

polling_interval_secs.description: The HTTP polling interval in seconds

method.description:
This is the method to be performed at the uri.
GET by default for action

headers.description: Custom HTTP headers to put on HTTP request

monitoring-param.description: List of monitoring parameters at the NS level

group-tag.description: A simple tag to group monitoring parameters

value-integer.description: Current value for an integer parameter

value-decimal.description: Current value for a decimal parameter

value-string.description: Current value for a string parameter

json-path.description: The jsonpath to use to extract value from JSON structure

object-path.description: The objectpath to use to extract value from JSON structure

min-length.description: Minimum string length for the parameter

max-length.description: Maximum string length for the parameter

control-param.description:
List of control parameters to manage and
update the running configuration of the VNF

group-tag.description: A simple tag to group control parameters

url.description: This is the URL where to perform the operation

method.description:
This is the method to be performed at the uri.
POST by default for action

payload.description:
This is the operation payload or payload template as stringified
JSON. This field provides the data  to be sent for this operation
call

action-param.description:
List of action parameters to
control VNF

group-tag.description: A simple tag to group monitoring parameter

url.description: This is the URL where to perform the operation

method.description:
This is the method to be performed at the uri.
POST by default for action

payload.description:
This is the operation payload or payload template to be sent in
the data for this operation call

xpath.description:
A an xpath that specfies which element in a descriptor is to be
modified.

value.description:
The value that the element specified by the xpath should take when a
record is created.

input-parameter-xpath.description:
List of xpaths to parameters inside the NSD
the can be customized during the instantiation.

xpath.description: An xpath that specifies the element in a descriptor.

default-value.description: A default value for this input parameter

total.description: The total number of VCPUs available.

used.description: The amount of memory (bytes) currently in use.
The amount of storage (bytes) currently in use.

total.description: The total number of external ports.
The total number of internal ports.

bytes.description: The cumulative number of incoming bytes.

packets.description: The cumulative number of incoming packets.

byte-rate.description: The current incoming byte-rate (bytes per second).

packet-rate.description: The current incoming packet (packets per second).

bytes.description: The cumulative number of outgoing bytes.

packets.description: The cumulative number of outgoing packets.

byte-rate.description: The current outgoing byte-rate (bytes per second).

packet-rate.description: The current outgoing packet (packets per second).

alarm-id.description:
This field is reserved for the identifier assigned by the cloud
provider

name.description: A human readable string to identify the alarm

description.description: A string containing a description of this alarm

vdur-id.description: The identifier of the VDUR that the alarm is associated with

repeat.description:
This flag indicates whether the alarm should be repeatedly emitted
while the associated threshold has been crossed.

enabled.description:
This flag indicates whether the alarm has been enabled or
disabled.

severity.description: A measure of the important or urgency of the alarm

metric.description: The metric to be tracked by this alarm.

statistic.description: The type of metric statistic that is tracked by this alarm

operation.description:
The relational operator that defines whether the alarm should be
triggered when the metric statistic is, say, above or below the
specified threshold value.

value.description:
This value defines the threshold that, if crossed, will trigger
the alarm.

period.description:
The period defines the length of time (seconds) that the metric
data are collected over in oreder to evaluate the chosen
statistic.

evaluations.description:
This is the number of samples of the metric statistic used to
evaluate threshold crossing. Each sample or evaluation is equal to
the metric statistic obtained for a given period. This can be used
to mitigate spikes in the metric that may skew the statistic of
interest.

server-group.description: Name of the Affinity/Anti-Affinity Server Group

name.description:
Place group construct to define the compute resource placement strategy
in cloud environment

requirement.description:
This is free text space used to describe the intent/rationale
behind this placement group. This is for human consumption only

strategy.description:
Strategy associated with this placement group
  Following values are possible
    - COLOCATION: Colocation strategy imply intent to share the physical
                  infrastructure (hypervisor/network) among all members
                  of this group.
    - ISOLATION: Isolation strategy imply intent to not share the physical
                 infrastructure (hypervisor/network) among the members
                 of this group.
